page.title: 19ALMONDBANK-R.N. WORKSHOPS
page.content: The Royal Naval Workshops (Almondbank) covers an area of about three hundred square meters. The Workshops are responsible for the repair and maintenance of Chinook, Puma and Lynx helicopters and therefore has connections with all three branches of the Armed Services. The complex is guarded by Ministry of Defence police and guard dogs. Most of the civilian workforce travel to the workshops from Perth, although a small number from the local environment, especially Almondbank village, are also employed there. Helicopters from all over the United Kingdom are sent to the Almondbank workshops for a variety of reasons which include servicing beyond the normal capabilities of routine maintenance and repair outwith normal Services facilities.
